etymology.description: 茅(茅) (máo, "cogon grass") refers to the type of grass native to the region. 台(台) (tái, "platform") often refers to a place or a location. When combined, 茅台(Máotái) becomes the name of a town in Guizhou Province famous for producing Maotai liquor, a renowned Chinese Baijiu.
etymology.interpretation: The word 茅台(Máotái) denotes the name of the town recognized for its production of Maotai liquor, signifying both its geographical origin and cultural heritage.

examples.chinese: 茅台是中国顶级的白酒品牌之一(茅台是中國頂級的白酒品牌之一)。
examples.pinyin: Máo tái shì Zhōngguó dǐngjí de báijiǔ pǐnpái zhī yī.
examples.english: Moutai is one of China's top premium baijiu brands.

examples.chinese: 我每次聚会时都喜欢喝茅台(我每次聚會時都喜歡喝茅台)，朋友认为这是一种奢华的味道(朋友認為這是一種奢華的味道)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měi cì jùhuì shí dōu xǐhuān hē Máo tái, péngyǒu rènwéi zhè shì yī zhǒng shēhuá de wèidào.
examples.english: I like to drink Moutai at every gathering, and my friends think it has a luxurious taste.

examples.chinese: 专家认为茅台不仅口感醇厚(專家認為茅台不僅口感醇厚)，而且香气扑鼻(而且香氣撲鼻)。
examples.pinyin: Zhuānjiā rènwéi Máo tái bù jǐn kǒugǎn chúnhòu, érqiě xiāngqì pūbí.
examples.english: Experts believe that Moutai is not only rich in flavor, but also has a fragrant aroma.
